intro: Lactuca winkleri, commonly known as Winkler's lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family (Asteraceae). It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers are clustered in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Lactuca winkleri is characterized by its adaptability to harsh conditions and is often found in rocky soils and open plains.
